III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Sufficiency of staff.
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4126
Section (1) The licensee shall have a sufficient number of administrative,
Description supervisory, social service, direct care, and other staff on duty to
perform the prescribed functions required by these administrative
rules and in the agency's program statement and to provide for the
continual needs, protection, and supervision of residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Over the weekend, a youth was sexually abused by another
youth. The perpetrating youth was moved to another pod once
staff were informed of the incident.
Investigation Interviews
Complainant was interviewed on 11/12/2024 by phone.
Complainant did not have additional information.
Youth A was interviewed on 11/13/2024 at Wayne County
Juvenile Detention. Youth A denied sexual acting out concerns on
Unit 3B. Youth A denied willingly or unwillingly giving his food tray
to another youth on Unit 3B. Youth A denied having concerns on
Unit 3B. Youth A stated youths are placed on and transferred off
the unit frequently and denied youths being transferred off the unit
for an issue involving him.
Youth B and Youth C were interviewed separately on 11/20/2024
at Wayne County Juvenile Detention. Each stated they reside on
Unit 3B. Youth B and Youth C denied participating or knowing
about sexual acting out issues on Unit 3B. Youth B and Youth C
denied exchanging or bullying for food occurs on Unit 3B.
Youth A’s mother was interviewed on 11/12/2024 by phone.
Youth A’s mother stated Youth A called her on 11/09/2024 from
Unit 3B. Youth A’s mother stated Youth A was upset and told her
that a youth, who had his hands in his own pants, pulled his hands
out and touched Youth A’s chin. Youth A’s mother stated Youth A
also told her that he was forced to give his food tray to another
youth. Youth A’s mother believed both incidents occurred on
11/09/2024 around lunch time.
Video
2

Unit 3B 11/09/2024 video was reviewed from multiple angles from
11:00 AM to 12:00 PM. Video does not record sound.
• Video shows one youth standing with his hands in the front
of his pants in the common area. This youth does not
approach and touch any youth.
• Video shows Unit 3B’s lunch cart is on the unit. Lunches
are passed out. A youth walks up to a table and places his
food tray down but takes the milk from the tray and drinks
it, before leaving. This is done in the presence of a male
staff. A female and male staff enter the unit and provide
additional food trays to any youth that approaches them.
Analysis The agency is found in compliance for providing for the needs,
protection and supervision of Youth A. Youth A denied boundary
concerns and being bullied for food. Unit 3B video on 11/09/2024
from 11:00 AM to 12:00 PM does not show boundary issues or
bullying for food.
CONSULTATION
It is recommended that staff redirects a youth when his hands are
inside the front of his elastic waistband pants.
Conclusion VIOLATION NOT ESTABLISHED
Rule Code Health services; policies and procedures.
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4142
Section (1) An institution shall establish and follow written health service
Description policies and procedures addressing all of the following:
(e) Dispensing medication.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Additional Finding: Youth was not provided with his asthma
medication.
Investigation Interviews
Youth A’s mother was interviewed on 11/12/2024 by phone.
Youth A’s mother inquired if Youth A has an inhaler for his
asthma. Youth A’s mother stated Youth A needs an inhaler. Youth
A’s mother was interviewed on 01/21/2025 by phone. Youth A’s
mother stated Youth A was admitted to Wayne County Juvenile
Detention without his asthma inhaler. Youth A’s mother stated
3

Youth A was released from Wayne County Juvenile Detention and
did not have asthma issues when he was there.
Youth A was interviewed on 11/13/2024 at Wayne County
Juvenile Detention. Youth A was asked about having asthma.
Youth A stated he has asthma and does not currently have access
to an inhaler. This information was shared with Program Manager
on 11/13/2024 for follow up.
Nurse was interviewed on 01/14/2025 at Wayne County Juvenile
Detention. Nurse does not recall Youth A’s asthma condition.
Nurse stated if a newly admitted youth arrives with an asthma
inhaler then it is used as prescribed but may change after the
youth has an intake physical exam completed by Wayne County
Juvenile Detention doctor. Nurse was asked about medication
administration record documentation. Nurse stated nursing staff
place their initials on the medication administration record on the
date when the medication is dispensed and taken by the youth.
Doctor was interviewed on 01/14/2025 at Wayne County Juvenile
Detention. Doctor does not recall Youth A’s asthma condition.
Doctor stated a newly admitted youth continues with asthma
inhaler use as prescribed by the originating doctor when the youth
has his asthma inhaler. Doctor stated youth with well controlled
asthma will be prescribed albuterol nebulizer for as needed use
and youth with active asthma will be prescribed albuterol nebulizer
for use at prescribed times.
Documentation
• 11/04/2024 Youth A was admitted to Wayne County
Juvenile Detention. Youth A’s initial nursing assessment
was completed. It does not document Youth A has asthma
or has an asthma inhaler.
• 11/12/2024 Youth A’s physical exam was completed. Youth
A’s assessment states asthma and “albuterol neb” is written
for plan.
• Youth A’s medication administration record lists “albuterol
neb” as needed every 4-6 hours with a start date of
11/13/2024. The medication administration record is blank
from 11/13/2024 to 11/30/2024 for albuterol neb.
• Wayne County Juvenile Detention policy and procedure
17.12 Use of Pharmaceuticals states youth arriving with
medication may have their medications continued with the
approval of the responsible doctor. The reason and
duration of the treatment must be documented in the
youth’s chart by the doctor. It further states the medication
4

must be in the original medication bottle with the name of
the prescribing doctor and telephone number and the name
of the pharmacy for the medication to be verified.
Analysis The agency is found in compliance as documentation indicated
Youth A was assessed for asthma, prescribed, and was offered
asthma medication.
TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
Clear documentation for as needed medication is required to
verify that it was offered. Nurse initials on medication
administration record for as needed medication indicates the as
needed medication was offered, dispensed and taken. Another
notation, such as “D” for decline on the medication administration
record, would indicate the as needed medication was offered and
declined by the youth. Leaving as needed medication blank on the
medication administration record makes it impossible to determine
if the as needed medication was not needed, not offered or
declined.
CONSULTATION
Rescue inhalers if prescribed are to be available for immediate
use when needed. Rescue inhalers may be kept in the nursing
medication room, however, rescue inhalers kept in a secure and
locked area on the unit or in an agency issued fanny pack for staff
to carry at all times may facilitate faster access and be a lifesaving
response.
Conclusion VIOLATION NOT ESTABLISHED
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules.
